Module com.example.fiftyclash
Package com.example.fiftyclash.models

Class GameModel

java.lang.Object
com.example.fiftyclash.models.GameModel
public class GameModel extends Object
Represents the main game model, managing the game's state, players, and interactions. It serves as the core logic for the game, handling player actions, machine actions, and turn management.

  • Constructor Details

    • GameModel

      public GameModel(String playerName, int machinesAmount)
      Constructs a new GameModel with the specified player name and number of machines.
      Parameters:
      playerName - the name of the human player.
      machinesAmount - the number of machines in the game.

  • Method Details

    • playMachine

      public int playMachine(int index)
      Executes a turn for the specified machine. If the machine cannot play a valid card, it is eliminated from the game.
      Parameters:
      index - the index of the machine taking its turn.
      Returns:
      the index of the card played by the machine, or -1 if the machine is eliminated.

    • getActiveMachineIndexes

      public List<Integer> getActiveMachineIndexes()
      Retrieves the indexes of all active machines.
      Returns:
      a list of indexes of active machines.

    • eliminatePlayer

      public void eliminatePlayer(int index)
      Eliminates a machine from the game, returning its cards to the draw deck.
      Parameters:
      index - the index of the machine to eliminate.

    • updateTurnLabel

      public void updateTurnLabel(int playerIndex)
      Updates the turn label with the current player's turn information.
      Parameters:
      playerIndex - the index of the player whose turn it is.

    • checkCanPlay

      public boolean checkCanPlay(int currentPoints, Player player)
      Checks if the given player can play any card without exceeding 50 points.
      Parameters:
      currentPoints - the current points in the game.
      player - the player whose cards are to be checked.
      Returns:
      true if the player can play a valid card, false otherwise.

    • getHumanCards

      public Card[] getHumanCards()
      Retrieves the cards held by the human player.
      Returns:
      an array of cards held by the human player.

    • getCurrentCard

      public Card getCurrentCard()
      Retrieves the current card on the table.
      Returns:
      the current card on the table.

    • playCard

      public void playCard(int index)
      Plays the specified card from the human player's hand.
      Parameters:
      index - the index of the card to play.

    • setCurrentCard

      public void setCurrentCard()
      Sets the current card on the table based on the play deck.

    • getMachinesAmount

      public int getMachinesAmount()
      Retrieves the total number of machines in the game.

      public boolean isMachineActive(int index)
      Checks if the specified machine is active in the game.
      Parameters:
      index - the index of the machine to check.
      Returns:
      true if the machine is active, false otherwise.

      Parameters:
